185514641.review: This game is not worth it, do not buy it. There may be a mod that u can install to make it playable but still, litteraly crashing during campaigns is just annoying.

185495419.review:
Игра для меня - просто легенда. Тактический режим - выше всяких похвал. Армия марширует громко, пушки грохочат, ружья стреляют сочно, от кавалерии сотрясается земля. Пара залпов - поле заволакивает дымом. Начинается сшибка армий и вся земля наполняется лязгом металла, грохотом выстрелов и криками людей и лошадей. Громить врага весело, преследовать и вырезать сдавшихся в плен - еще веселее.
У тактики  один существенный недостаток - нет ощущения того, что это действительно наполеоновские войны, а не сходка реконструкторов. Поправляется легко - шаманьте текстовый файл таким образом, чтобы увеличить численность отрядов ровно в пять раз, а число пушек - втрое. И тогда игра будет действительно эпичным приключением. Полазьте по форумам - там вас научат. Без этого - удовольствие от игры сомнительное. Разве что морские сражения и экономика доставят. 
Второй существенный недостаток - дипломатия. ИИ в какой то момент сходит с ума и становится дешевой шлюхой. Даже имея с вами союз, они в какой то момент за три копейки от Вашего врага объявляют вам войну, даже если у вас нормальные отношения. Когда ты играешь за Францию - тебе плевать. Война со всеми - твое нормальное состояние.
А вот когда ты постоянный член антифранцузских коалиций, например как у меня была игра за Австрию и на тебя без какой бы то ни было причины постоянно нападают твои вчерашние союзники - Пруссия или Россия, это просто сюр. ИИ даже близко не так заботится о своей репутации, как ты. Во общем, игра явно требует перезапуска - 15 лет прошло как никак. Пока основная масса мечтает о перезапуске Medieval, я мечтаю о перезапуске Napoleon.

When going into the war and many fights going on then yes, the form on the buildings and soldiers become accurate but, majority of game is played from Birds eye view.

This game proves how patient people can be it is a step by step game, with building a civilisation and getting units to scout other tiles which are adjacent.

Если вы будете играть в ванилу, то есть оригинальную игру, то вы не сможете получить должного удовольствия: малые отряды, карты, ограниченное типы солдат и тд. Также нельзя заключить нормального мира, когда стороны конфликта полностью выходят из войны. Например Франция, Бавария, Гессен воюет против Австрии. Франция и Австрия заключают мир, но при это Бавария продолжает воевать против Австрии. В целом это игра лучшее, что есть по Наполеонике.

184520171.review:
I would absolutely recommend Napoleon. It's a great Total war game of its time, yet it also plays nice nowadays.

The campaign in truly grand, yet not overextended.

Opinion on land battles depends on whether player likes line infantry combat like in Empire or Shogun 2 FotS to a certain degree. Naval battles are a masterpiece of its own.

Multiplayer isn't something that excited me personally. Campaigns are only pvp, and regular pvp matches aren't as polished as in the future title.

Overall, it's an excellent title for a TW veteran or someone just getting familiar with this series.

184494051.review: Doesn't crash (unlike Empire Total War). One caveat; England seems to be poorly managed by the AI, it doesn't make use of the numerous trading positions available to it. I've seen endgames in which London has close to the lowest levels of government and military buildings. England's goal should be to fill the trade positions with merchant ships, and then invade Spain (as happened historically) to get at France.

183937247.review: The game is certainly very dated, but you can still have fun with it.

183922598.review:
--Campaign
Campaign mechanics are not overly complex and easy to understand, which I like, because you can focus on strategy and having fun, while not being bored or limited in your options. European map could be bigger. AI sucks and doesn't have any strategy at all (like in literally all CA games). Auto-generated maps in land and siege battles suck, since they are very simple and look almost the same. 

--Combat
-Land battles
Major factions have some advantages and disadvantages, so you need to choose your army wisely, which I like. Some units are completely worthless though. The combat consists of both strategy and micromanagement, which feels nice to play  - you need to master both, if you want to win. The balance of time to kill, shooting range, maneuverability is amazing. Probably the most complex and strategically interesting CA game along with Shogun 2 in terms of battles (but I don't like Shogun's increased infantry range and art's first person view(wtf?!)). 
-Naval battles
There is a reason why no one plays them. They suck. It feels nice initially, but there is little diversity in them. If there were different maps which contain islands and coast that would have been much more interesting to play. 

--Scenario battles
Here AI is scripted and sometimes it actually looks like it has some strategy. Overall, provides a decent challenge, especially for those, who never played CA games before. However, the amount of scenario battles disappoints considering how many battles were there during Napoleonic wars. 

--Multiplayer
The chat was removed lol. Maps are decent, but half of the scenario battles are imbalanced in terms of army composition and terrain advantage. Also, people who played scenario battle before have a massive advantage, since it has no pre-game timer to evaluate the battlefield. And because there are no new maps, some people just play the same maps, like bots, and play every time exactly the same best strategy that they figured out. It's great that there is actually no skill-based matchmaking and your rating (or stars) don't mean anything, otherwise it would be impossible to play for some people, because they lost all their rating due to playing against human bots. 

--Graphics & Sound
Aged like a wine.

--Bugs
There are a lot of them. Some bugs even affect your gameplay and require you to take them into account while playing, otherwise you will lose.

--Conclusion
One of the best CA games theoretically. It has the most interesting setting out of all so far. No cringe top bar abilities, no constant boring melee fights with spears and shields. Decent campaign. It's worth to play it if you like RTS genre. 
There could be so much more: bigger campaign map; smarter AI that doesn't use cheats in campaign and that has a strategy in battles; fixed all the bugs; a lot more scenario battles; new multiplayer maps every couple of months. Yet, it seems like CA's business model is creating a new game or a DLC as an update, rather than actually making your existing projects better. Maybe someday someone competent will figure out the true potential and will make a game like that, or someone will buy CA when they eventually go bankrupt and will update the game, but it's unlikely. 
Was a good ride, now let's continue enshitiffication with other games.

I found it to be a really good addition to the total war franchise,  Having to maintain a navy and an army adds a lot of depth and playability
